Use formula to assign a property for the product grade to the signals " Product Viscosity
Definition.Document:
Creating Histograms to Visualize the Fit of the Model on a Grade-by-Grade Basis

Starting Point 

1. Add back signal for Product_Viscosity, condition for all grades (with properties), condition for Product Viscosity OS, and condition for Model Predicts Correct Direction from Target.

2. Use formula to assign a property for the product grade to the signals "Product Viscosity OS (with Grade Property)" and "Model Predicts Correct Direction from Target (with Grade Property)". 

$inverse = $ModelPredictsCorrect.inverse(7d)

$AllGradesWithProperty.minus($inverse).combineWith($ModelPredictsCorrect).filter($capsule->$capsule.getProperty('Value').toNumber().isGreaterThan(1))

3. Create a signal from condition of the Percentage of Off-spec production that was predicted by the model. 

4. Create a histogram for the average percent of off-spec production predictable with the model, sorted by product grade code. 

5. Create a second histogram for the average product viscosity sorted by grade.

Final view of Histograms
